results.title: Clomiphene, metformin, or both for infertility in the polycystic ovary syndrome.
results.text_hl: With the exception of @DISEASE_Pregnancy_Complications @DISEASE_MESH:D011248 @@@pregnancy complications@@@, adverse-event rates were similar in all groups, though @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@gastrointestinal side effects@@@ were more frequent, and @<m>DISEASE_Rhinitis_Vasomotor</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012223 @@@vasomotor and ovulatory symptoms@@@ less frequent, in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group than in the @CHEMICAL_Clomiphene @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002996 @@@clomiphene@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Legro RS, Barnhart HX, Schlaff WD, Carr BR, Diamond MP, Carson SA, Steinkampf MP, Coutifaris C, McGovern PG, Cataldo NA, Gosman GG, Nestler JE, Giudice LC, Leppert PC, Myers ER, Cooperative Multicenter Reproductive Medicine Network. Clomiphene, metformin, or both for infertility in the polycystic ovary syndrome. N Engl J Med. 2007 Feb 8;356(6):551-66. PMID: 17287476
